channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the bottom of the package was wet. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered it was placed inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023071096
item.description:
Report X-2023071096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023071096 SequenceEvent: This package was discovered in the AM and was placed inside a lined hazmat tote and stored inside the hazmat cage. Upon inspection, 5 gal pail of Ecolab laundry sour liquid appeared to be leaking from the top of the cap. DescribePack: The barcode that was on top of the cap looked wet and stained. There was green liquid near and along the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a lined hazmat tote. 2. X-2023071099 SequenceEvent: This package was discovered in the AM and was placed inside a lined hazmat tote and stored inside the hazmat cage. Upon inspection, the 5 gallon pail contained Ecolab laundry sour liquid. DescribePack: The top of the cap was wet, and small amount of its content leaked through top of cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a lined hazmat tote. 3. X-2023071100 SequenceEvent: This package was discovered in the AM and was placed inside a lined hazmat tote then stored inside the hazmat cage. Upon inspection, 5 gal pail contained Ecolab laundry sour liquid. DescribePack: The barcode that was on top of the cap looked wet and stained. A Small amount of the liquid had leaked through the top of the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a lined hazmat tote. 4. X-2023071102 SequenceEvent: This package was discovered in the AM and was placed inside a lined hazmat tote and stored inside the hazmat cage. Upon inspection, 5 gal pail of Ecolab laundry sour liquid had leaked out a small amount of its contents onto the top of cap. DescribePack: The top of the cap had a small hole allowing leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immiedetly placed inside lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060794
item.description:
Report X-2023060794

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/30/2023 at approximately 0200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 245617 at the station location in Burlington, reporting an undeclared flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 1 plastic bottle of Arm-R-Seal, packed in a fiberboard box. The package raised suspicion because it displayed orientation arrows and made a liquid sound . The SDS found online by the agent classifies the commodity as UN 1263. The package was not prepared with the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report I-2023070029

Report I-2023070029

  • Carrier/Reporter: YRC FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the trailer, three batteries were found damaged and leaking. The release was properly managed. The damaged batteries were placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.
